text:
Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information. 
Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection 
On this page 
 
CVE-2023-5997 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Nov 16, 2023  
Assigning CNA: 
Chrome 
CVE-2023-5997  
 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

metadata.title: Chromium: CVE-2023-5997 Use after free in Garbage Collection
metadata.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2023) for more information.
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in Garbage Collection, identified as CVE-2023-5997. This vulnerability, assigned by Chrome, is in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) consumed by Microsoft Edge. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user. Microsoft has addressed this vulnerability by ingesting Chromium, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. The fix is provided through the release of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with the build number 119.0.2151.72 for the Stable channel and 118.0.2088.109 for the Extended Stable channel. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
metadata.nvd_description: use after free in garbage collection in google chrome prior to 119.0.6045.159 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted html page. (chromium security severity: high)
